title: Abstract Wiki Frame Schema: Language
description: JSON schema for the LanguageFrame semantic structure used for natural languages, constructed languages, sign languages, and dialects.

frame_type.description: Stable frame identifier; must be "entity.language" for LanguageFrame instances.

main_entity.description: The language entity this frame describes, typically mirroring semantics.types.Entity (id, name, entity_type, extra, etc.).

parent_language.description: Optional parent or macrolanguage entity (e.g. for dialects or closely related varieties).

language_family_lemmas.description: Lemma-like labels for the language family / subgrouping (e.g. "indo_european", "germanic", "bantu").

regions.description: Location-like objects representing main regions / countries where the language is used.

items.description: Location-like object, typically mirroring semantics.types.Location (id, name, kind, extra, etc.).

writing_systems.description: Names or identifiers for writing systems / scripts used by the language (e.g. "Latin", "Cyrillic", "Devanagari").

standard_lemmas.description: Lemma-like labels for standard varieties (e.g. "standard_german", "standard_arabic"), if applicable.

speaker_estimate.description: Approximate number of speakers (all varieties), if known.

speaker_estimate_year.description: Reference year for the speaker estimate (e.g. census or survey year).

regulatory_bodies.description: Entity-like objects for language academies or regulatory bodies (e.g. "Académie française").

standardization_events.description: Event-like objects representing codification / standardization milestones (e.g. publication of grammars, official reforms).

other_names.description: Other commonly used names or designations for the language (endonyms or exonyms, as free strings).

endonym.description: Name of the language in the language itself, if applicable.

exonyms.description: Exonyms: names used by other languages for this language.

attributes.description: Open-ended attribute map for additional structured facts about the language (e.g. SVO/SOV order, phonological inventory size). Keys should be strings.

extra.description: Free-form metadata bag for provenance, debug info, or original-source fields that are not directly interpreted by NLG.
